page.title: 19Recent Changes
page.content: In the past twenty-five years there have been quite a few changes in the area. The three main villages have grown in size as it has become more popular to live in a local village instead of in the town. This has meant a great deal of change for our school at St. Mewan. The increase in numbers resulted in the school being enlarged in two main phases adding many extra classrooms to the school site. The increase in the tourist trade has meant a lot of extra traffic through our area and the two main roads to Truro and Newquay have been widened and levelled. The village shops and post offices have tended to suffer because of this increased mobility and many have closed down. Some of the Clay Pits have closed for economic reasons but the sites are still used for other purposes. (Mike Yates)
